channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Potholes again outside the village hall, 28th March
item.description:
There is an ongoing problem with the deterioration of the road surface outside the Leckhampton village hall in Church Road. This has been repaired a number of times recently, the last repair was just last week! As you can see from the photo the road service has deteriorated again, the road and pavement are strewn with stones that weren’t cleaned up and the potholes filling with water is causing pedestrians to get wet as drivers try and pass along the narrow road. I’m not convinced that the smallest possible patch that seems to be applied to repair the road surface is actually cost-effective. It looks like you have to return again and gain to repair the road surface. Personally I think the whole strip in front of the village hall needs replacing otherwise you’re gonna be back again and again and again. I’m also concerned about the general quality of some of the pothole repairs in the area. When I compare it with the quality of the repairs that take place in the Royal Borough of Windsor and Maidenhead, I can see that they cut the road into a defined square and repair outside of the pothole and they level off properly, not unevenly, to stop repeated patching. This makes a much more robust repair to the road surface than simply putting tarmac into the hole and compacting it down. I appreciate this is not my area of expertise, but just looking at how some of the recent repairs around Old Bath Road and around Leckhampton have deteriorated after they’ve been repaired, I think a new approach is required as it seems tax payers money is being wasted.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Leckhampton Village Hall Church Road, Leckhampton
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Whole road surface gone, 28th March
item.description:
Huge chunks of the road surface are now missing over around 50 yards of the road. Not so much of a pothole, as opposed to half road / half hole. Urgent resurfacing clearly required.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 260 Priors Road, Prestbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blocked gullies in Montpellier Gardens, 28th March
item.description:
At least 2 blocked gullies, on path running across gardens towards stature of William IV. These have been blocked for a VERY long time, and cause water to run down path along edge of gardens. Need cleaning out - ALL gullies in gardens need cleaning, not just the two shown in the attached photos.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 8 Glensanda Court Montpellier Spa Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Several craters the size of the moon appearing!, 27th March
item.description:
This is the 3rd time since 2018 that these pot holes have reappeared Might actually be time to redo the whole roundabout as patching them doesn’t seem to work As they are most likely above the min/max size of a pot hole as per the procedure the council has and have been present for 2, coming into their third week, it’s good to see the inspectors are out in force regularly checking the roads and marking holes of concern to be fixed within the required SLAs…. Ooooor not!!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 4 Barnett Way, Barnwood
Report on FixMyStreet
